author: @KNOE8
title: 4-year-old and infant in Colorado found safe after endangered missing alert
text: 4-year-old and infant in Colorado found safe after endangered missing alert STERLING, Colo. ( [KKTV](https://www.kktv.com/2023/12/28/statewide-alert-issued-colorado-missing-4-year-old-infant/)/Gray News) - A statewide alert issued in Colorado on Thursday for two young children has been canceled, [KKTV reports.](https://www.kktv.com/2023/12/28/statewide-alert-issued-colorado-missing-4-year-old-infant/) The Colorado Bureau of Investigation issued an alert for 4-year-old Zuryah Thalacker and 23-month-old Ansom Thalacker. Officials say the two children were located and were safe as of 3 p.m. on Thursday. Officials say the children have been missing since Wednesday at 1:30 p.m. when they were last seen in the Sterling area. The alert stated that the children may have been with 28-year-old Justina Lambert. The CBI did not disclose the relationship between the three in the alert. The alert said the children were believed to be traveling in a 2007 White Nissan Murano with CA license plate 9ERA912, with the rear bumper missing. Copyright 2023 KKTV via Gray Media Group, Inc. All rights reserved.

author: Ann Lowy
title: Your View: Trump’s behavior doesn’t align with Ten Commandments
text:
Opinion SUBSCRIBER ONLY Opinion | Your View: Trump’s behavior doesn’t align with Ten Commandments Town Square Cartoons By Ann Lowy | alowy@mcall.com | The Morning Call December 24, 2023 at 10:30 a.m. Trump’s behavior doesn’t align with Ten Commandments To all those Christians who think Donald Trump is their savior, please note the Ten Commandments. Number one: Thou shalt have no other gods before me. Thou shalt not kill, thou shalt not commit adultery, thou shalt not steal, thou shalt not bear false witness against thy neighbor, thou shall not covet thy neighbor’s wife, or his goods. These are a few issues with Donald Trump as leader. He has said he alone can save us and get retribution; God said vengeance is mine, I will repay. Can he shoot someone in Times Square and not lose a vote, can he commit adultery as often as he wants, even when his wife is home with a baby? Has he not lied when he called Mike Pence a traitor? Please, people, wake up and see the evil and deception in this man. Don’t vote for him because he is against abortion. He is against all that most people with a conscience believe. Let’s keep religion and politics separate. Think and vote for the best person to help this country to be whole again. Don’t vote for someone who betrays his friends for his own benefit and profit.
Palma Moyer
Richland Township
Heritage Foundation provides propaganda, not facts I have a simple, but lengthy question: Why does The Morning Call continue to print right-wing propaganda generated by the Heritage Foundation, a known Republican think tank that, among other things, helped write the Project 2025 document? That’s the “presidential transition project” that provides a clear and detailed outline of how to create a Republican administration in the United States that will subjugate democratic thought and pave the way for a long-term authoritarian government under Donald Trump and his successors. I grow tired of these attempts to be duped into believing what the Heritage Foundation claims are facts, when in reality are nothing but prejudicial claims aimed at toppling the Biden administration.
Dennis Scholl
Hellertown
Fellow diner’s kindness left lasting impression On entering the Hanover Eatery alone, I encountered a stranger, Mary, with whom I shared a unique story. Mary invited me to join her and her friend for breakfast. I was very grateful for her kind invitation and explained that I was expecting my friend Anne at any time.
Toward the end of our meal, Mary came by to wish us a Merry Christmas, which was so thoughtful and, of course, was reciprocated, and then she left.
When waiting for our bill, our waitress came over to tell us it had been paid by Mary. We were so absolutely and pleasantly surprised, to say the least, by such a kindly, gratuitous act. Perhaps we may not meet Mary ever again, but will remember being overwhelmed by her spirit of kindness and generosity. Thank you and God bless, Mary.
Kathy Rich
Bethlehem
GOP wrong on impeachment, funding for Ukraine The Day One Dictator has issued his orders and as a result the obsequious Republicans in the House of Representatives have voted unanimously to launch an investigation into whether there is any evidence of wrongdoing on the part of President Biden that would rise to the level of warranting impeachment. Undoubtedly tens and tens of millions of taxpayers’ dollars will be spent on this fishing expedition, while in the meantime no additional funding will be forthcoming to prevent Putin from defeating and then annexing Ukraine. My heart goes out to the Ukrainians who are about to experience the full impact of a seasoned dictator’s plan of expansion at the expense of the fledgling democracy that is Ukraine.
James McMahan
Lower Macungie Township
Holiday Pops show featured impressive performances On Dec. 16, my family and I enjoyed two hours of outstanding holiday entertainment. We were in attendance for the annual Holiday Pops presented by Miller Symphony Hall. The Allentown Symphony Orchestra was amazing as always. Additional performances were equally impressive. Dancers from Accent School of Dance and the O’Grady Quinlan Academy of Irish Dance performed flawlessly. An additional highlight was the inspiring voices of the Emmaus High School Chorale; what a talented group of young people! Thank you to all the participants and all those connected to this wonderful holiday event; a perfect way to enjoy the holiday season. Merry Christmas!
Patricia Smull
Easton
PennDOT signs don’t help drivers protect road workers Will someone at PennDot please explain why: (1) There are so many “work zones” where nobody is working or likely to be working for weeks; (2) why the flashing signal telling drivers if the work zone is active and requires slowing down is placed toward the middle or the end, not the beginning, of the work zone; and (3) why work zone signs remain in place seemingly forever, well after the work is done. Drivers want to protect workers, but when the signage bears no relationship to the actual work situation, they get frustrated — and ignore the 55 mph limits.
Jack Johannes
Allentown
Peace Pilgrimage made more difficult by current events For me, the Peace Pilgrimage of 2023 was more challenging than ever, and not just because of my age. It was harder to balance and stay focused on the path ahead, especially with two wars raging, and weapons needed for both.
Should we step forward with aid for Ukraine, arm Israel to fight with Hamas or stand aside? How can we ignore the suffering of the innocent people whose lives are in ruins? How can we stop the killing and find our way out of the labyrinth of endless wars?
It is not easy to continue walking from Nazareth to Bethlehem when real people in another Bethlehem and Nazareth face fear and hatred every day. It is hard, knowing how long the people of Ukraine have been suffering. It is not easy to walk knowing even the children have no safe places. Should we keep walking? Should we keep arming? Can we find a way to force the raging wars to stop without using force?
This December we joined many first-time pilgrims, stubbornly walking, hoping for the impossible, hoping to find the road to peace. Maybe, what we really need is for everyone, everywhere to join us.
Debra Orben
Springfield Township
The Morning Call encourages community dialogue on important issues. Submit a letter to the editor at letters@mcall.com .

author: globo.com
title: Israel mata comandante da unidade aérea do Hezbollah | Mundo | G1
text:
1 de 1 Bombardeio israelense deixa estragos em Beirute, no Líbano, em 24 de setembro de 2024 — Foto: REUTERS/Amr Abdallah Dalsh Bombardeio israelense deixa estragos em Beirute, no Líbano, em 24 de setembro de 2024 — Foto: REUTERS/Amr Abdallah Dalsh
Um ataque aéreo israelense matou o comandante do Hezbollah responsável pela unidade aérea do grupo extremista libanês. Muhammad Srour foi morto em Beirute , capital do Líbano , nesta quinta-feira (26).
✅ Clique aqui para seguir o canal de notícias internacionais do g1 no WhatsApp
A informação da morte de Srour foi confirmada pelo Hezbollah e pelas Forças de Defesa de Israel (FDI).
Segundo os israelenses, Srour planejou e comandou diversos ataques terroristas aéreos, incluindo ataques com drones, mísseis de cruzeiro e veículos aéreos não tripulados (VANTs) direcionados contra a população de Israel.
Nos últimos anos, o membro do Hezbollah teria liderado o projeto da fabricação de VANTs no sul do Líbano, estabelecendo locais de fabricação próximos a infraestruturas civis em Beirute e em áreas do sul do Líbano.
Segundo a FDI, Srour integrou o Hezbollah na década de 1980 e ocupou diversos cargos dentro do grupo extremista, incluindo comandante da unidade de mísseis, comandante da Unidade "Aziz" da Força Radwan, bem como emissário do Hezbollah no Iêmen e no Comando Aéreo do regime terrorista Houthi.
A morte de Muhammad Srour é mais um dos comandantes do Hezbollah mortos por Israel nos últimos dias. Ainda nesta semana, os israelenses mataram o comandante da divisão de mísseis e foguetes.
A Força Aérea de Israel tem realizado "extensos ataques" contra alvos do grupo extremista no sul do Líbano, em uma escalada no conflito entre israelenses e o Hezbollah nos últimos dias. (Leia mais abaixo)
LEIA TAMBÉM:
Israel 'não deseja' invadir o território do Líbano, diz embaixador israelense na ONU Rússia prepara ataque contra instalações nucleares e deve ser 'forçada' a fazer paz, diz Zelensky
Israel x Hezbollah
Israel afirmou que está conduzindo uma operação militar na fronteira com o Líbano para que moradores da região possam voltar para casa. Esses israelenses deixaram a área por causa de ataques do grupo extremista Hezbollah, que atua no Líbano.
Hezbollah e Israel possuem um histórico de desavenças, que já resultou em uma guerra em 2006. O conflito na região voltou a se intensificar em outubro de 2023. À época, o grupo terrorista Hamas invadiu Israel, o que resultou na morte e sequestro de civis.
Em resposta, Israel declarou guerra contra o Hamas e bombardeou a Faixa de Gaza. Desde então, o Hezbollah vem lançando foguetes contra Israel para demonstrar apoio ao grupo terrorista e aos moradores de Gaza.
Na semana passada, pagers e walkie-talkies usados por membros do Hezbollah explodiram em uma ação coordenada. Em seguida, Israel anunciou que estava movendo tropas para a região de fronteira com o Líbano.
Israel também lançou uma série de bombardeios contra o Líbano, justificando que estava atacando estruturas do Hezbollah.
Diante disso, a ONU levantou preocupações sobre uma guerra total no Oriente Médio.
"O Líbano está à beira do precipício. O povo do Líbano, o povo de Israel e o povo do mundo não podem permitir que o Líbano se torne outra Gaza", disse o Secretário-Geral da ONU, António Guterres.
VÍDEOS: mais assistidos do g1
50 vídeos

author: Laura Densmore
title: FB Disables Account of Christian Who Complained Against Pro-Hamas Terrorist Posts
text:
A friend of mine, who wishes to remain anonymous, (so I will call him George), phoned me this evening to tell me what happened to him with Facebook. He is a Christian, and years ago, he moved from an Arab country to the United States to have a life of greater freedom. He speaks and reads both English and Arabic fluently. He has a “friend” on Facebook who is a Physician in Saudi Arabia, Mahmoud Al Araby.
Mahmoud would post on Facebook daily with posts in Arabic that were inciting violence against Israel and the IDF, such as:
“Here is the news today! Your heroes (Hamas terrorists) killed 10 IDF soldiers today!” and
“The media is lying. We are making headway in Gaza! We are winning the war against the IDF!”
“Today 20 IDF soldiers were trapped in one of the Gaza tunnels. Our heroes came out of nowhere and shot and killed them! Allah Akbar!”
So, my friend, George, who reads Arabic, reported this abusive content to Facebook, complaining to them that this person is
promoting violence and incitement on the Facebook platform. This is a clear violation of their Community Standards. Certainly, we can all agree that Hamas is a dangerous terrorist organization, right? You would think that this is a clear violation of Community Standards on Facebook, right?
Not so! After doing a review of George’s complaint, Facebook came back to him and told him that Mahmoud Al Araby’s posts were within Facebook Community standards.
George continued to see the hateful posts against Israel, the Jews, and the IDF in the Gaza war and so he resent his complaint and asked for a second review of Mahmoud’s posts.
Three days later, Facebook came back and DISABLED George’s account! Permanently!
George had been on Facebook for over 20 years and had always been in good standing with them. He was in the middle of a travel trip when his account was disabled and he was cut off from his FB messenger travel group. They had been sending him maps and info for his trip.
He cannot sign on. There is absolutely NO RECOURSE. There is no appeal process. There is NO phone number to call. He tried reaching out to and there has been no reply.
He tried reaching out to a specialty help desk outside of Facebook, and the technician told him that this happens to LOTS of people, and when your account is disabled, you have NO RECOURSE.
Isaiah 5:20 talks about a day when good is called evil and evil is called good. Truly, we are living in those days now!
So, the pro-Hamas terrorist doctor in Saudi Arabia still has an active Facebook account, and my friend, George, a Christian, who, in good faith, was trying to report Mahmoud for inciting violence and terrorism is now KICKED OFF Facebook!
Folks, it’s time to BOYCOTT Facebook! PERMANENTLY!
Life is BETTER without Facebook!
Previously published by
Bridge Connector Ministries

author: EIN News
title: Impresiv Health and Inovaare Launch Strategic Partnership to Streamline Compliance for Health Plans - Golf News Today - EIN Presswire
text:
Impresiv Health and Inovaare Launch Strategic Partnership to Streamline Compliance for Health Plans ORLANDO, FL, UNITED STATES, April 23, 2025 / EINPresswire.com / -- Impresiv Health and Inovaare have relaunched their strategic partnership, renewing their shared mission to help health plans simplify and strengthen their regulatory compliance operations, creating the compliance officer's best friend with tools and support tailored to their needs. By combining Impresiv Health’s consulting and implementation experience with Inovaare’s intelligent compliance management platform, the partnership delivers a streamlined, end-to-end solution that helps compliance teams reduce risk, cut through complexity, and operate with confidence.
“Compliance doesn’t have to be overwhelming,” said Marcus Fontaine, President of Impresiv Health. “Through this partnership, we’re giving health plans the tools and expert support they need to get ahead of regulatory challenges—without burning out their internal teams.”
As health plans face growing pressure to manage complex Medicare, Medicaid, and Commercial program requirements, this partnership offers a smarter way forward. Inovaare’s cloud-based regulatory compliance management platform acts as a Compliance Officer's best friend, automating workflows while offering real-time dashboards and built-in regulatory updates. Impresiv Health complements this with deep operational expertise, technology guidance, and implementation support.
“Our clients are looking for ways to reduce compliance risk without sacrificing agility,” said Pravat Rout, CEO of Inovaare. “Together with Impresiv, we’re delivering a scalable solution that’s easy to implement and even easier to manage—so compliance leaders can focus on strategy, not spreadsheets.”
Whether supporting a digital transformation or optimizing existing processes, the Impresiv–Inovaare partnership provides the strategic and technical foundation health plans need to remain audit-ready and fully compliant, all while improving internal efficiency and member experience.
About Impresiv Health
Impresiv Health is a healthcare management consulting firm specializing in clinical operations, payer services, and health information management. Founded with the mission to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of healthcare delivery, Impresiv Health combines deep industry expertise with innovative solutions to address the complex challenges faced by healthcare organizations today.
Your success matters, and we know it. That’s Impresiv.
www.impresivhealth.com
CONTACT: Cortney Galster, Marketing Director | cgalster@impresivhealth.com
About Inovaare Corporation
Inovaare transforms complex compliance processes by designing configurable solutions so healthcare organizations can collect real-time data across internal and external departments, creating one compliance management system. Inovaare's comprehensive suite of HIPAA-compliant software solutions features best-practice regulatory processes to help healthcare organizations efficiently meet their unique business requirements, sustain audit readiness, reduce non-compliance risks and lower overall operating costs.
www.inovaare.com
CONTACT: Tom Wagner | Director of Marketing | 949.554.8147 | tom.wagner@inovaare.com
SOURCE: Impresiv Health
Cortney Galster
Impresiv Health
+1 6519554768
cgalster@impresivhealth.com

author: @WMCActionNews5
title: School board member apologizes for threatening to have person deported
text:
School board member apologizes for threatening to have person deported
MEMPHIS, Tenn. (WMC) - Shelby County Board of Education member Towanna Murphy issued an apology Wednesday after messaging a person and threatening to “have them deported.”
A screenshot of Murphy’s message was sent to Action News 5. In the message, Murphy responds to the person’s criticism by saying, “Baby be quiet before I have you deported.”
She also insulted the person’s looks and said “Your mama a b---.”
School board chair Joyce Dorse Coleman issued a statement following the comments, saying the board does not condone them.
Coleman did not say Murphy faces any punishment at this time.
“As Board Chair, I, along with my colleagues, will continue to review any further necessary steps in addressing Board Member Murphy’s activity pursuant to Board Policy.”
In Murphy’s statement, she acknowledged her response, “did not represent the professionalism and respect that I know should be a standard in my service as an MSCS Board Member.”
You can read her full apology here:
Click here to sign up for our newsletter!
Click here to report a spelling or grammar error. Please include the headline.

author: Carl Petersen
title: Desperate Republicans And The Threat Of Violence
text: " [If I don't get elected, it's going to be a bloodbath for the whole country.]" - Donald Trump Police officer crushed in doorway by rioters during Capitol breach (The Guardian) ( [Image](visuals/2024/08/2024-08-503224-500-Uploaded-populum_visuals_2024_08_2024-08-503224-police-officer-crushed-in-doorway-by-rioters-during-capitol-breach-817.jpg)by [The Guardian](https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/video/2021/jan/10/police-officer-crushed-in-doorway-by-rioters-during-capitol-breach-video)) [Details](/populum/attrdetails.php?vid=180567) [DMCA](/populum/dmca.php?vid=180567) The Republican party has lost touch with the electorate. Voters have soundly rejected its conservative views on [abortion](https://www.pewresearch.org/religion/fact-sheet/public-opinion-on-abortion/#:~:text=While%20public%20support%20for%20legal,in%20all%20or%20most%20cases.) and [marriage equality](https://news.gallup.com/poll/1651/gay-lesbian-rights.aspx#:~:text=The%20data%20are%20presented%20in,and%205%25%20throughout%20the%20years.). Beholden to lobbyists from the gun industry, Republican politicians have [rejected common-sense gun control proposals](https://medium.com/discourse/guns-dont-kill-people-bullets-do-b86a1528e432?sk=c24c688c8f3600ba1e7fb5cecdd09348) that enjoy [widespread, bipartisan support](https://www.mprnews.org/story/2023/07/25/poll-majority--support-universal-background-checks-gun-licensing-assault-weapons-ban). While Republican politicians continue to deny that man-made climate change is an issue, " [two-thirds of Americans prioritize developing alternative energy sources, like wind and solar.](https://www.pewresearch.org/short-reads/2023/08/09/what-the-data-says-about-americans-views-of-climate-change/)" The party advocates repealing Obamacare even though [62% of Americans view the Affordable Care Act favorably](https://www.kff.org/affordable-care-act/poll-finding/5-charts-about-public-opinion-on-the-affordable-care-act/). Instead of using these losses as an opportunity to course correct, the Republican party has doubled down on its unpopular platform resulting in its slow and painful death. The Republican candidate has lost the popular vote in seven of the past eight presidential elections. In the years since Bill Clinton defeated the older Bush to deny him a second term, only the younger Bush has been able to win more votes than the Democrat. While securing the majority in his reelection attempt, The Shrub only secured his first term when the Supreme Court handed him the Presidency with a ruling so partisan that the justices declared it could not be used as precedent by future courts. Trump had fewer votes than Hilary Clinton but won in the antiquated Electoral College, a feat that he was unable to repeat in 2020. Frustrated by this string of losses the party has increasingly turned towards violence. The last election cycle concluded with an attempted insurrection on January 6, 2021, which resulted in [$2.7 million of damage to the Capitol Building](https://www.justice.gov/usao-dc/24-months-january-6-attack-capitol), 174 injured police officers, and the [deaths of four of their fellow protestors](https://medium.com/discourse/justice-for-ashli-babbitt-8fc6636e10da?sk=53b36b4d9b106c25ddfe7cd118c66f3b). Instead of condemning this assault on democracy, Trump has referred to its participants as patriots. The defeated former President calls those convicted for their roles in the violent attempt to overturn an election "hostages" and promises to use his pardon power to free them if he is returned to the White House. In his third attempt to secure the presidency, Trump has continued to engage in rhetoric that threatens to inject violence into the democratic process. Not only has he continued to spread false claims that the 2020 election was stolen from him, but he regularly tells his followers that the only legitimate outcome for this year's election is one in which he is the victor. Any loss would indicate that it was stolen, an outcome that would justify a "bloodbath for the country" at the hands of his followers. Should Trump occupy the White House for a second term, he is already promising to be a dictator on "day one". His administration would be guided by the Heritage Foundation's "Project 2025"; a 1,000-page playbook that " [calls for far-reaching changes in government, including rolling back protections for the LGBTQ community and infusing Christianity more deeply into society](https://www.politico.com/news/2024/07/04/leader-of-the-pro-trump-project-2025-suggests-there-will-be-a-new-american-revolution-00166583)". The proposals in "Project 2025" are so radical that the leader of the Heritage Foundation considers them to be a " [second American Revolution](https://www.politico.com/news/2024/07/04/leader-of-the-pro-trump-project-2025-suggests-there-will-be-a-new-american-revolution-00166583)". He promises that this revolution will be bloodless " [if the left allows it to be](https://www.politico.com/news/2024/07/04/leader-of-the-pro-trump-project-2025-suggests-there-will-be-a-new-american-revolution-00166583)". Stand in their way by voting against Trump and all bets are off. While introducing VP candidate JD Vance at a pro-Trump rally, Ohio state senator George Lang took the threat one step further. Claiming that this November's election is " [the last chance to save our country](https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/politics/ohio-state-senator-issues-groveling-apology-for-saying-it-will-take-civil-war-to-save-us-if-republicans-lose-election/ar-BB1qtSJs?ocid=entnewsntp&pc=U531&cvid=1feea19146134deca3d2dd3d890bcc9f&ei=44)", the elected official said that if they lose " [it's going to take a civil war to save the county](https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/politics/ohio-state-senator-issues-groveling-apology-for-saying-it-will-take-civil-war-to-save-us-if-republicans-lose-election/ar-BB1qtSJs?ocid=entnewsntp&pc=U531&cvid=1feea19146134deca3d2dd3d890bcc9f&ei=44)". He concluded that in the event of such a war, he was " [glad we got [SIC] people like "Bikers for Trump on our side](https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/politics/ohio-state-senator-issues-groveling-apology-for-saying-it-will-take-civil-war-to-save-us-if-republicans-lose-election/ar-BB1qtSJs?ocid=entnewsntp&pc=U531&cvid=1feea19146134deca3d2dd3d890bcc9f&ei=44)". " [Calls to violence threaten our democracy's foundation. You can't love your country only when you win.]" - President Biden With less than a hundred days to the election, one party is asking for your vote while the other is threatening to take control no matter the election's result. It is clear which side deserves the vote of those who support the continuation of democracy in our country. Carl Petersen is a parent advocate for public education, particularly for students with special education needs, who serves as the Education Chair for the Northridge East Neighborhood Council. As a Green Party candidate in LAUSD's District 2 School Board race, he was endorsed by Network for Public Education (NPE) Action. Dr. Diane Ravitch has called him " [a valiant fighter for public schools in Los Angeles.](https://dianeravitch.net/2021/01/25/emiliana-dore-charter-schools-are-not-the-answer/)" For links to his blogs, please visit [www.ChangeTheLAUSD.com](http://www.changethelausd.com/). Opinions are his own.

author: Redacción Nación
title: Delincuentes que viajaron desde la Costa para robar celulares en la Feria de Cali son capturados por la Policía
text: La Feria de Cali es uno de los eventos más esperados a final de año por el nivel de programas que se desarrollan durante la última semana de diciembre y a la que llegan miles de turistas nacionales y extranjeros, pero la inseguridad unida a la presencia de ladrones también son factores que se presentan en ella.En esta ocasión, la Policía Metropolitana de Cali capturó a cuatro personas que, al aparecer, estarían robando celulares de quienes llegan a la feria para disfrutar de la temporada. “Cuatro hombres, quienes al parecer estarían hurtando celulares en los eventos de la Feria de Cali, fueron capturados por unidades del Modelo Nacional de Vigilancia Comunitaria por Cuadrantes en el barrio el Lido, sur de la capital vallecaucana”, señaló la Policía. Según la información recolectada por las autoridades estos sujetos llegaron desde la costa Caribe para hacer de las suyas en Cali durante la temporada de feria y decembrina. La captura se dio por la llamada de una ciudadana y la Policía pudo dar con los delincuentes que se movilizaban en un vehículo. “Ante el reporte de un posible hurto, la Policía activó los protocolos de búsqueda contando con las características de los presuntos delincuentes y del vehículo en el que se movilizaban”, indicó la Policía. En el momento de la requisa les hallaron 35 celulares que habrían sido hurtados a las personas bajo la modalidad de cosquilleo. Los implicados cuentan con antecedentes por los delitos de hurto , por lo que fueron dejados a disposición de la Fiscalía General de la Nación y un Juez de Control de Garantías. Capturan en Cali a hombre que causó terror en centro comercial; esto fue lo que hizo La Policía Metropolitana de Santiago de Cali logró este jueves, 28 de diciembre, la captura de un hombre que causó verdadero terror en un centro comercial, ya que, intentó atacar a varios empleados con una arma blanca.Por la alteración al orden público, la Policía se acercó de forma rápida al centro comercial para tratar de solucionar la situación. Después de varios minutos, el hombre pudo ser reducido por las autoridades. La ciudadanía intentó lincharlo, pero fracasó en el intento.“La oportuna intervención de las unidades adscritas a la Estación de Policía La Flora permitió salvaguardar la vida e integridad de las mujeres. El implicado fue capturado y trasladado a un centro hospitalario donde permanece bajo custodia ”, agregó.De acuerdo con las personas afectadas en el centro comercial, en información recogida por El País de Cali , el hecho se presentó a las 10:00 a. m., hora colombiana. Muchas personas grabaron los momentos de terror que se vivieron en el centro comercial.“En un reconocido centro comercial ubicado en el norte de Cali, unidades del Modelo Nacional de Vigilancia Comunitaria por Cuadrantes capturaron en flagrancia a un hombre cuando intimidaba con un arma cortopunzante a tres trabajadoras de este establecimiento de comercio ”, señaló la Policía.“Lo que hace el tipo es que intenta esconderse en el Centro Comercial para evitar la turba que venía detrás persiguiéndolo y en el local hay un cerco de matas y se tira por encima del cerco e ingresa al negocio y arrincona a las empleadas; las tomó como rehenes durante aproximadamente cinco minutos”, dijo Carlos Gil, propietario de un restaurante al que el delincuente ingresó de forma violenta, en palabras recogidas por El País de Cali .

author: Tommy Culkin
title: Sunny weekend on horizon for Casper - Casper, WY Oil City News
text: CASPER, Wyo. — Casper area residents will be able to close the book on 2023 in style, as the National Weather Service predicts good weather for the final weekend of the year. According to the NWS, today will likely be sunny, with a high temperature near 43 degrees expected. Conditions throughout the day should be breezy, with southwest winds moving through the region at 11-17 mph. Wind gusts as strong as 26 mph may be possible in the afternoon. At night, cloud coverage will begin to move in, and temperatures will fall to a low of around 30 degrees. The strong winds aren’t expected to die down after nightfall, with the NWS reporting that wind gusts of roughly 25 mph may continue into the late night hours. Saturday’s forecast is similar, with the NWS calling for mostly sunny skies and a high temperature near 45 degrees. Saturday winds could see gusts as high as 20 mph. Saturday night will feature temperatures dipping down to a low of roughly 21 degrees. And winds should begin to die down in the evening, with the NWS reporting only moderate winds of less than 10 mph during the night.

author: @ChristianPost
title: Yes, ‘Christ is King’ — that is bad news for antisemites
text: Yes, ‘Christ is King’ — that is bad news for antisemites We live in interesting times. Seems like no truth statement can stand on its own without being twisted into something nefarious. A recent trend on X (formerly known as Twitter) has been a useful case-in-point. The phrase “Christ is King” has been making waves over the last week. This statement has apparently become a dog whistle and a rallying cry for antisemites. For some bizarre reason, even self-professing Muslims like [Andrew Tate](https://twitter.com/Cobratate/status/1772221317019799930) and [SNEAKO](https://twitter.com/sneako/status/1772048489372880911), as well as notorious anti-Jewish activists like [Nick Fuentes](https://divinity.uchicago.edu/sightings/articles/when-christ-and-trump-are-kings), have adopted this basic Christian truth not to really praise Jesus, but to spite Jewish people. On the face of it, proclaiming Jesus as Lord is one of the oldest confessions of faith of historic Christianity. Why wouldn’t we want Christ’s name proclaimed and exalted? Why shouldn’t this be a cause for rejoicing? Well, because it’s 2024, and anything and everything nowadays is used as pretense for stirring hatred and division — even the Lordship of Christ. And no amount of feigned sincerity on the part of these individuals can hide their true motivations. This is not an act of worship; it is bigotry masquerading as religious devotion. They can pretend all they want, “but the Lord looks on the heart” (1 Samuel 16:7, ESV). This is ultimately bad news for anyone who knowingly harbors gratuitous hatred for Jewish people. Why? Because if Christ is an enemy of the Jews, He’s their enemy as well. 'To the Jew first…' The Apostle Paul writes: “For I am not ashamed of the Gospel, for it is the power of God for salvation to everyone who believes, to the Jew first and also to the Greek. For in it the righteousness of God is revealed from faith for faith” (Romans 1:16-17). Why isn’t Paul ashamed of this Gospel? Because there’s no greater promise than the one revealed in it. Through it, we are counted righteous and forgiven in the sight of the Almighty. Through it, we gain access to God’s presence. Through it, Paradise’s gates are flung open. This isn’t just “good news;” it’s the best news. And yet, Paul says that God’s plan of salvation starts with the Jewish people. In His sovereign decree, God chose to reveal His Word and Gospel through them. This fact can’t be overlooked. Even though God describes the Jews as “stiff-necked people” (Exodus 32:9; 33:3), He chooses them as His instrument and unworthy recipients of His grace. The Hebrew Bible records how time after time, despite Israel’s disobedience and sin, God continues to keep His promises to them. In Jeremiah we read, “Thus says the Lord: Behold, I will restore the fortunes of the tents of Jacob and have compassion on his dwellings … and you shall be my people, and I will be your God” (Jeremiah 30:18; 22). God’s law is repeatedly broken, and God keeps blessing the lawbreakers. They deserve wrath, but they receive mercy. Why? Because of their outstanding moral uprightness? No. Because of His faithfulness and lovingkindness (Romans 3:34, Ezekiel 36:22). Now, this should give pause to people like Andrew Tate and Nick Fuentes. Anyone who truly understands grace should be humbled by all of this. It should cause self-reflection. These blessings were extended to the Jews by God’s divine mercy. And it is His mercy alone that keeps all of us from falling under God’s wrath. If anything, confessing Christ's Lordship should humble us; not drive us towards malice. At the end of the day, if Christ has cause to hate the Jews, He has equal cause to hate you too. It’s only His mercy that keeps you from falling. And by indulging in ethnic hatred, you’re merely storing up wrath for yourself. You can fool others, but you can't fool the omniscient Creator. Here is the good news God’s grace is extended to all nations; not just the Jews: “My house shall be called a house of prayer for all peoples” (Isaiah 56:6-7). That’s the New Covenant promise, and God never breaks His promises. Through Christ, the “wall of hostility” between Jews and gentiles has been brought down (Ephesians 2:14). No one is excluded; everyone is invited — including repentant antisemites. Christ IS King! And one day everyone will bow and make that confession. Let’s pray that people like Nick Fuentes do so sincerely. There’s still time. Daniel Vaida is Assistant Opinion Editor at The Christian Post in Washington, D.C.
